metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12420 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When trying to connect to a STUN server, a race condition could have caused a use-after-free of a pointer, leading to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.10, Firefox < 78, and Thunderbird < 68.10.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12420` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

thunderbird - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine
